title: GeoView Core Config Schema
comments: Configuration for GeoView core packages, each packages manages it own schema. It correspond to the TypeMapFeaturesInstance type.

en.description: The English version of the string.

fr.description: The French version of the string.

nameField.description: The display field (English/French) of the layer. If it is not present the viewer will make an attempt to find the first valid field.

outfields.description: A comma separated list of attribute names (English/French) that should be requested on query (all by default).

fieldTypes.description: A comma separated list of types. Type at index i is associated to the variable at index i.

aliasFields.description: A comma separated list of attribute names (English/French) that should be use for alias. If empty, no alias will be set if not found.

fillStyle.description: Kind of filling  for vector features. Default = solid.

crossOrigin.description: The crossOrigin attribute for loaded images. Note that you must provide a crossOrigin value if you want to access pixel data with the Canvas renderer.

defaultLabel.description: Label used if field/value association is not found.

defaultVisible.description: Flag used to show/hide features associated to the default label (default: true).

defaultSettings.description: Settings used if field/value association is not found.

visible.description: Flag used to show/hide features associated to the label (default: true).

legendCollapsed.description: Is the layer's legend initially collapsed.

controls.description: The status of various controls for the layer (available/unavailable).

bounds.description: The geographic bounding box that contains all the layer's features.

extent.description: The extent that constrains the view. Called with [minX, minY, maxX, maxY] extent coordinates.

minZoom.description: The minimum view zoom level (exclusive) above which this layer will be visible.

maxZoom.description: The maximum view zoom level (inclusive) above which this layer will be visible.

className.description: A CSS class name to set to the layer element.

states.description: The status of initial states for the layer.

TypeVectorSourceFormats.description: The feature format used by the XHR feature loader when access path is set.

dataAccessPath.description: The path (English/French) to reach the data to display. If not specified, metadataAccessPath will be assigned to it.

dataProjection.description: The projection code of the source. Used only for GeoJSON format. Default value is EPSG:4326.

strategy.description: The loading strategy to use. By default an all strategy is used, a one-off strategy which loads all features at once.

separator.description: The character used to separate columns of csv file

origin.description: The tile grid origin, i.e. where the x and y axes meet ([z, 0, 0]). Tile coordinates increase left to right and downwards. If not specified, extent must be provided.

resolutions.description: Resolutions. The array index of each resolution needs to match the zoom level. This means that even if a minZoom is configured, the resolutions array will have a length of maxZoom + 1.

tileSize.description: The tile grid origin, i.e. where the x and y axes meet ([z, 0, 0]). Tile coordinates increase left to right and downwards. If not specified, extent must be provided.

extraOptions.description: Additional options used for OpenLayers map options

shaded.description: Enable or disable shaded basemap (if basemap id is set to shaded then this should be false).

TypeBasemapId.description: Id of the basemap to use.

TypeInteraction.description: If map is dynamic (pan/zoom) or static to act as a thumbnail (no nav bar).

TypeHighlightColors.description: Color to use for feature highlights.

TypeListOfGeoviewLayerConfig.description: List of GeoView Layers in the order which they should be added to the map.

geoviewLayerId.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer (does not relate directly to any external service). The id will have the language extension (id-'lang').

geoviewLayerName.description: The display name of the layer (English/French). If it is not present the viewer will make an attempt to scrape this information.

serviceDateFormat.description: Date format used by the service endpoint.

externalDateFormat.description: Date format used by the getFeatureInfo to output date variable.

isTimeAware.description: Flag to mention if layer will use its time dimension if provided. Used to remove a layer from time enabled functions like time slider.

initialSettings.description: Initial settings to apply to the GeoView layer at creation time.

listOfLayerEntryConfig.description: The layer entries to use from the GeoView layer.

geoviewLayerId.description: The id of the layer for referencing within the viewer (does not relate directly to any external service). The id will have the language extension (id-'lang').

geoviewLayerName.description: The display name of the layer (English/French). If it is not present the viewer will make an attempt to scrape this information.

initialSettings.description: Initial settings to apply to the GeoView layer at creation time.

initialView.description: Settings for the initial viewing area of the map.

enableRotation.description: Enable rotation. If false, a rotation constraint that always sets the rotation to zero is used.

maxExtent.description: The extent that constrains the view. Called with [minX, minY, maxX, maxY] extent coordinates.

minZoom.description: The minimum zoom level used to determine the resolution constraint. If not set, will use default from basemap.

maxZoom.description: The maximum zoom level used to determine the resolution constraint. If not set, will use default from basemap.

rotation.description: The initial rotation for the view in degree (positive rotation clockwise, 0 means North). Will be converted to radiant by the viewer.

extent.description: The extent for the initial view. Called with [minX, minY, maxX, maxY] extent coordinates.

layerIds.description: Geoview layer ID(s) or layer path(s) of layer(s) to use as initial map focus.

prefixItems.description: Initial map zoom level. Zoom level are define by the basemap zoom levels. Levels between whole numbers are supported to fine tune initial view.
Initial longitude value for map center.
Initial latitude value for map center.

TypeZoomAndCenter.description: Initial zoom and center coordinates to set map view.

TypeValidMapProjectionCodes.description: Spatial Reference EPSG code supported (https://epsg.io/). We support Web Mercator and Lambert Conical Conform Canada.

TypeNavBarProps.description: Controls available on the navigation bar.

core.description: Default core tabs of footer bar to use. NOTE: config from packages for time-slider and geochart are in the same loaction as core config (<<core config name>>-<<package name>>.json).

custom.description: Custom tabs of footer bar to use

collapsed.description: State of footer bar when map is loaded (expanded or collapsed)

core.description: Default core tabs of app-bar to use. NOTE: config from packages like geochart are in the same loaction as core config (<<core config name>>-<<package name>>.json).

hideOnZoom.description: Minimum zoom level to show overview map

TypeMapComponents.description: Core components to initialize on viewer load. The schema for those are inside this file.

TypeMapCorePackages.description: Core map packages to initialize on viewer load. The schema for those are on their own package. NOTE: config from packages are in the same loaction as core config (<<core config name>>-<<package name>>.json).

name.description: External Package name. The name must be identical to the window external package object to load.

configUrl.description: The url to the external package configuration setting. The core package will read the configuration and pass it inside the package.

TypeExternalPackages.description: List of external packages to initialize on viewer load.

geocoreUrl.description: Service end point to access API for layers specification (loading and plugins parameters). By default it is GeoCore but can be another endpoint with similar output.

proxyUrl.description: An optional proxy to be used for dealing with same-origin issues.  URL must either be a relative path on the same server or an absolute path on a server which sets CORS headers.

geolocator.description: Service end point to access geo location of searched value.

TypeLocalizedLanguages.description: ISO 639-1 code indicating the languages supported by the configuration file.

TypeListOfLocalizedLanguages.description: ISO 639-1 code indicating the languages supported by the configuration file. It will use value(s) provided here to access bilangual configuration nodes. For value(s) provided here, each bilingual configuration node MUST provide a value.

TypeValidVersions.description: The schema version that can be used to validate the configuration file. The schema should enumerate the list of versions accepted by this version of the viewer.

TypeMapFeaturesInstance.description: The map features configuration. This type is used by the IsValidTypeMapFeaturesInstance method coded in config-validation.ts file. It does the validation down to the list of layer entry config.
